Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Harpocrates with hair in side knot. Head only. Mould-made and hollow. Red-brown Nile silt fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Good parallels from Naukratis (Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA706; NA698; Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1896-1908-E.4693) and early 3rd century AD Athribis (Tell Atrib, Szymańska 2005, no.65). Roman parallel (Dunand 1990, nos. 201, 288). Dunand, F. 1990. Catalogue des Terres cuites gréco-romaines d’Egypte. Musée du louvre. Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Paris. Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.106) (Phase 3)
